title: Emerging Artists Compete for Brits Critics' Choice Award
summary: The Brits Critics' Choice Award nominees for 2026 have been announced, featuring Sienna Spiro, Jacob Alon, and Rose Gray as the selected up-and-coming artists. This award, previously known as Brits Rising Star, is designed to highlight promising talent in the music industry, chosen by a panel of industry experts. The winner will be revealed in January, ahead of the Brit Awards ceremony on February 28 in Manchester, marking the first time the event is held there. The award aims to boost the careers of new musicians, as seen with past winners like Adele and Sam Fender. Rose Gray, an east London artist, expressed excitement about the nomination, noting it will introduce her to a broader audience. She has already made an impact with her debut album 'Louder, Please' and performances with acts like Confidence Man and the Sugababes. Sienna Spiro shared her overwhelming reaction to the news, highlighting the emotional significance of such recognition. This award serves as a platform for emerging artists to gain visibility and advance their musical journeys in the competitive industry.

background_read: The Brits Critics' Choice Award is a prestigious UK music award established in 2008 to recognize emerging talent. It is part of the Brit Awards, an annual ceremony celebrating British and international music. A panel of music industry experts selects nominees based on potential and early achievements. Past winners, such as Adele and Sam Fender, have gone on to achieve significant success, demonstrating the award's role in launching careers. The award highlights the importance of supporting new artists in a competitive industry, providing them with exposure and opportunities to connect with wider audiences.
